tasks.title: Initialize Project Structure and Build Configuration
tasks.description: Set up the foundational project structure with Vite, TypeScript, React 18, and Tailwind CSS. Configure Chrome Extension Manifest V3 build pipeline.
tasks.details:
1. Initialize npm/pnpm project with package.json
2. Install core dependencies: react@18, react-dom@18, typescript, vite, tailwindcss
3. Install dev dependencies: @vitejs/plugin-react, @types/chrome, @types/react, @types/react-dom, vite-plugin-web-extension
4. Create tsconfig.json with strict mode and Chrome types
5. Create vite.config.ts with web extension plugin configuration
6. Set up Tailwind CSS with postcss.config.js and tailwind.config.js
7. Create directory structure:
   - src/
     - background/ (service worker)
     - content/ (content scripts)
     - popup/ (extension popup UI)
     - options/ (settings page UI)
     - shared/ (shared utilities, types, constants)
   - public/ (static assets, icons)
8. Create manifest.json in public/ with Manifest V3 structure:
   - manifest_version: 3
   - permissions: ["storage", "activeTab"]
   - host_permissions: ["*://*.youtube.com/*"]
   - background: { service_worker: "background.js", type: "module" }
   - content_scripts for youtube.com
   - action: { default_popup: "popup.html" }
   - options_page: "options.html"
9. Add build scripts to package.json: dev, build, preview
10. Create .gitignore entries for node_modules, dist, build artifacts
tasks.testStrategy:
1. Verify npm install succeeds without errors
2. Run 'npm run build' and confirm dist/ folder is generated
3. Verify manifest.json is valid using Chrome's extension validator
4. Load unpacked extension in Chrome and confirm it appears in chrome://extensions
5. Verify TypeScript compilation works without errors
6. Check that Tailwind CSS processes correctly

tasks.title: Set up Husky, Automated Formatting/Testing, and Git Hooks
tasks.description: Configure development workflow automation with Husky for Git hooks, Prettier for code formatting, ESLint for linting, and lint-staged for pre-commit checks following TypeScript/React 18 best practices.
tasks.details:
1. Install and configure Husky for Git hooks management:
   - npm install --save-dev husky
   - npx husky install
   - Add "prepare": "husky install" to package.json scripts
   - Create .husky directory structure
   - Set up husky hooks to work with Windows and Unix environments

2. Install and configure Prettier:
   - npm install --save-dev prettier
   - Create .prettierrc.json with recommended settings:
     - printWidth: 100
     - semi: true
     - singleQuote: true
     - trailingComma: 'es5'
     - tabWidth: 2
     - arrowParens: 'always'
     - endOfLine: 'auto' (for cross-platform compatibility)
   - Create .prettierignore (exclude dist/, node_modules/, .git/, *.md)
   - Add "format": "prettier --write ." to package.json scripts
   - Add "format:check": "prettier --check ." for CI/CD

3. Install and configure ESLint for TypeScript + React 18:
   - npm install --save-dev eslint @typescript-eslint/parser @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin
   - npm install --save-dev eslint-plugin-react eslint-plugin-react-hooks
   - npm install --save-dev eslint-config-prettier (to prevent conflicts)
   - Create .eslintrc.json with:
     - parser: '@typescript-eslint/parser'
     - parserOptions: { ecmaVersion: 'latest', sourceType: 'module', ecmaFeatures: { jsx: true } }
     - extends: ['eslint:recommended', 'plugin:@typescript-eslint/recommended', 'plugin:react/recommended', 'plugin:react-hooks/recommended', 'prettier']
     - plugins: ['@typescript-eslint', 'react', 'react-hooks']
     - rules: { 'react/react-in-jsx-scope': 'off' (React 18), 'react-hooks/rules-of-hooks': 'error', 'react-hooks/exhaustive-deps': 'warn' }
     - settings: { react: { version: '18.0' } }
   - Create .eslintignore (dist/, node_modules/, vite.config.ts initially)
   - Add "lint": "eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx" to package.json scripts
   - Add "lint:fix": "eslint . --ext .ts,.tsx --fix" to package.json scripts

4. Install and configure lint-staged:
   - npm install --save-dev lint-staged
   - Add lint-staged config to package.json:
     {
       "lint-staged": {
         "*.{ts,tsx}": [
           "eslint --fix",
           "prettier --write"
         ],
         "*.{json,css,md}": [
           "prettier --write"
         ]
       }
     }

5. Set up pre-commit hook with Husky:
   - npx husky add .husky/pre-commit "npx lint-staged"
   - Ensure hook runs linting and formatting on staged files only
   - Add error handling to prevent commits with unfixable lint errors
   - Test with both clean and dirty code to verify hook execution

6. Set up pre-push hook (for future test integration):
   - npx husky add .husky/pre-push "npm run test -- --run"
   - Initially this will be a placeholder until Task 12 implements tests
   - Add conditional check: if test script exists, run it; otherwise skip
   - Add comment explaining test integration happens in Task 12

7. Configure TypeScript-specific linting rules:
   - Enable strict type checking rules
   - Add rules for consistent import ordering
   - Configure rules for Chrome Extension APIs (no-undef exceptions)
   - Set up path aliases support if using @ imports

8. Add helpful npm scripts to package.json:
   - "check": "npm run lint && npm run format:check" (for CI)
   - "fix": "npm run lint:fix && npm run format" (quick local fix)
   - "prepare": "husky install" (auto-install hooks after npm install)

9. Create CONTRIBUTING.md with:
   - Pre-commit hook behavior explanation
   - How to bypass hooks (--no-verify) for emergencies only
   - Formatting and linting standards
   - How to run checks manually before committing

10. Verify cross-platform compatibility:
    - Test hooks on Windows (MSYS_NT per env)
    - Ensure line endings work correctly (LF for hooks, auto for code)
    - Add executable permissions to hook files if needed
    - Document any platform-specific setup requirements

Optimize CSS selectors for performance (avoid universal selectors, deep nesting). Consider injecting critical CSS early and deferring non-critical CSS. Document CSS injection strategy and measured improvements.

tasks.title: Fix SPA Navigation: Implement Centralized Page Change Coordinator
tasks.description: Resolve SPA navigation bug where search page filtering doesn't work when navigating from home page via search bar. Implement centralized navigation coordinator in content.ts to detect page changes and initialize/cleanup appropriate modules.
tasks.details:
## Implementation Status:  COMPLETED

### Changes Successfully Applied

#### 1. content.ts (src/content/content.ts) - Centralized Navigation Coordinator
**Added:**
- `getCurrentPageType()` function - Detects current YouTube page type ('home' | 'search' | 'watch' | 'other')
- `handlePageChange()` function - Manages module cleanup and initialization during navigation
- Module state tracker variables:
  - `currentPageType: 'home' | 'search' | 'watch' | 'other' | null`
  - `currentSettings: YouTubeSettings | null`
- Global navigation listeners in `initialize()`:
  - Wrapped `history.pushState` to intercept SPA navigation
  - Wrapped `history.replaceState` to intercept URL changes
  - Added listener for YouTube's `yt-navigate-finish` custom event
  - Added `popstate` listener for browser back/forward buttons
- Updated `watchSettings()` to use centralized `handlePageChange()`

**Result:** content.ts now acts as the single source of truth for page navigation, properly coordinating module lifecycle across all navigation methods.

#### 2. home-page.ts (src/content/youtube/home-page.ts) - Removed Local Navigation Logic
**Removed:**
- `setupNavigationListener()` function (lines 282-332)
- `isHomePage()` function - page detection now handled by content.ts
- `navigationCleanup` variable (line 56)
- Navigation setup call from `initHomePageModule()` (line 357)
- Navigation cleanup from `cleanupHomePageModule()` (lines 379-383)

**Result:** Module now focuses solely on home page-specific DOM manipulation logic.

#### 3. search-page.ts (src/content/youtube/search-page.ts) - Removed Local Navigation Logic
**Removed:**
- `setupNavigationListener()` function (lines 316-366)
- `isSearchPage()` function - page detection now handled by content.ts
- `navigationCleanup` variable (line 65)
- Navigation setup call from `initSearchPageModule()` (line 392)
- Navigation cleanup from `cleanupSearchPageModule()` (lines 413-417)

**Result:** Module now focuses solely on search page-specific content filtering logic.

### Bug Fix Verified

**Original Problem:**
When navigating from YouTube home page to search results via the search bar:
- Search page module was never initialized
- Shorts and filter chips remained visible
- Content filtering did not apply

**Root Cause:**
- content.ts only ran on initial page load
- home-page.ts navigation listener only cleaned up but didn't trigger search initialization
- search-page.ts navigation listener wasn't active until first initialization
- No cross-module coordination existed

**Solution Applied:**
Centralized navigation coordinator in content.ts that:
1. Detects page type changes using `getCurrentPageType()`
2. Cleans up previous module before transitioning
3. Initializes new module with current settings
4. Handles all navigation methods (search bar, links, back/forward)

**Verification:**
- Build completed successfully with no errors
- Home  Search navigation now properly initializes search page filtering
- Shorts and filter chips correctly hidden when navigating from home to search
- Extension works for both direct URL navigation and SPA navigation

### Architecture Benefits Achieved
-  Single source of truth for navigation in content.ts
-  Proper cleanup  initialization handoff between modules
-  Modules focus solely on their page-specific logic
-  Foundation laid for watch page module (future)
-  Prevents duplicate navigation listeners
-  Consistent behavior across all navigation methods
